profileAlternative.name: Phil Kasiecki
profileAlternative.headline: Versatile Software Engineer | Real-time & embedded systems | C, C++, Linux | Device drivers, diagnostics, software tools
profileAlternative.summary:
I enjoy multi-faceted software engineering work because it helps me contribute more to a team and allows me to understand more about a system. My diverse experience includes software development tools, embedded systems, device drivers and diagnostics, and I have impacted multiple components of software products.

My experience includes low-level software that required knowledge of microprocessors down to the bus cycle and signal level, as well as object-oriented software that is hardware agnostic. I have also thrived in non-technical aspects such as documentation or presenting a new development to a group of people.

I have extensive experience with C that includes low-level programming, object-oriented C++ and Linux that includes dealing with the kernel as well as system programming. In addition, I have authored a wide range of technical documentation, from user manuals to software generation documents.

Skills:
Operating Systems: Windows 7, Solaris, Linux (Fedora, Ubuntu)
Programming Languages: C, C++, Unix/Linux shell script, Tcl, SQL, C#, Java, Perl, Python, Assembly (M68K, PowerPC)
Applications/Tools: Microsoft Visual Studio, Eclipse, Visual SlickEdit, ClearCase, SVN, CVS, Qt, git
Other technologies: National Instruments LabWindows and TestStand, Agilent and Tektronix logic analyzers, HP3458A DVM

Manage staff writers and columnists, directing coverage with season previews and recaps as well as recurring features

positions.title: Senior Software Engineer
positions.description:
Software engineering for medical devices
* Enhanced parts of a large C code base by fixing issues found via static analysis and in-house testing.
* Investigated a range of monitoring unit issues including cybersecurity concerns.
* Led early support for the use of a strip recorder with a patient monitoring device.
…
see more

positions.title: Instructor
positions.description: Teach technical classes as part of the program: Algorithms and Data Structures, Nailing the Technical Interview

positions.title: Senior Staff Software Engineer
positions.description:
Software development for a leading vendor of security and alarm systems
* Developed automated design verification programs and unified them along with an existing menu-driven design verification tool into one diagnostic program.
* Leveraged an automated design verification program to test hardware with varying environment settings.
* Added the ability to upload preconfigured settings from a USB drive to a subscriber using a C program and Linux shell script.
* Led development of a protocol used as a primary component in an automated manufacturing test setup.
* Improved the ability to upgrade firmware via USB, including how it notifies users of progress or problems via an LCD.
* Leveraged existing code to add the ability to forward a network packet as-is, allowing for easy test of known bad packets.
* Assisted in automation of many functional tests using Python and Selenium.
…
see more

positions.title: Software Engineer
positions.description:
Software Research & Development Engineer in the Environmental and Process Monitoring Instruments Group
* Ported an instrument series platform from the Linux 2.4 kernel to the 2.6 kernel
* Aided customer input options by modifying the standard Linux keyboard driver to support a USB keypad for an instrument series.
* Co-led graphical user interface development for a continuous emissions monitoring instrument.
* Developed software for parts of an SNMP register agent, MySQL database agent and graphical user interface that comprised a next generation platform.
* Fixed a long-standing time skew problem with an instrument, led the new release containing the fix, and updated the software generation document for the product to reflect numerous changes since the last update.
…
see more

positions.title: LTX-Credence
positions.description: LTX-Credence was formed by the merger of LTX and Credence, completed at the end of August 2008.

positions.title:
Title
Software Engineer
positions.description: LTX-Credence was formed by the merger of LTX and Credence, completed at the end of August 2008.

positions.title:
Title
Software Engineer
positions.description:
Software engineer in the Diagnostics, Calibration and Verify group.
* Enhanced diagnostics for the company's RF products to support new hardware that automates the calibration procedure. This included proper detection of a USB file system mount, unifying calibration programs and implementing proper abort mechanisms.
* Played a leading role in the conversion of diagnostic programs to use a new reporting format, many of which were completed ahead of schedule.
* Converted two diagnostic programs from an internal language into C++-based programs.
* Refactored functionality from a diagnostic program into two reusable utility classes.
* Developed a diagnostic for an adapter that provides compatibility between two tester architectures, utilizing prior work from a similar diagnostic.
* Unified a diagnostic for multiple platforms into one program.
* Successfully mentored a new college graduate in the department.
…
see more

positions.title: Contributing Writer
positions.description:
Produced regular columns on national subjects of interest in college basketball, as well as live-blogging game coverage.
For the NCAA Tournament, authored "Names You Need to Know", on X-factors for participating teams and stars hidden on teams out of the public eye.

positions.title: Software Engineer
positions.description:
Client was iRobot
Software development on Linux for components with the PackBot line of robots.
* Ported a client's device driver previously developed for the Linux 2.4 kernel to the 2.6 kernel, altering source code and the build process.
* Configured and built a kernel for early work on a new robot operating system.
…
see more

positions.title: Consulting Engineer
positions.description:
Software consulting for firms in the embedded systems industry
* Improved a client’s documentation generation by cleaning up internal tools, documenting the generation process, and putting guidelines in place for using future releases of a commercial tool used in the process, all finished ahead of schedule.
* Documented previous internal research on re-hosting real-time systems from VxWorks to Linux, and further researched re-hosting device drivers and system libraries/services.
…
see more

positions.title: Software Engineer
positions.description:
Software development for real-time trace development tools, with a focus on PowerPC microprocessors.
* Designed and implemented real-time trace and run control components for embedded microprocessors utilizing a logic analyzer, supporting processors with high external bus speeds.
* Co-developed a system for automated firmware builds and testing, helping firmware engineers deliver a better product to the quality assurance team for their testing.
* Developed firmware and host-based trace for embedded PowerPC processors.
* Ported source code for a host-based trace component from Windows to UNIX platforms.
* Co-led documentation efforts for real-time trace solutions, including the migration of existing components to a new debugger.
* Assisted with the migration of a real-time trace solution to a new debugger.
…
see more

positions.title: Hardware Engineer (Co-op)
positions.description:
Performed various tasks in the Test Development group
* Developed and maintained an intranet status reporting system in Perl and C++, allowing engineers to easily submit project status and managers to more easily track projects by time and engineer.
* Co-designed a new test fixture by helping with schematics and the hardware specification, and developing algorithms for its design verification tests.
…
see more

positions.title: Diagnostic Engineer (Co-op)
positions.description:
Performed regression testing of diagnostic software and videoconferencing hardware.
Wrote test scripts in Microsoft Test to automate diagnostic software testing of high priority bugs.

given.text:
Phil is an innovative, detail oriented basketball writer, analyst with terrific insight and understanding of all levels of basketball and the business of basketball. Phil runs Hoopville Media. I've had the pleasure of working with Phil on a number of events. Phil has deep knowledge of media functionality and event planning, organizing and execution. Because of Phil's range of experience, knowledge, contacts and expertise he is well known and is held in high regard in basketball circles- Ray Porch Assistant Men's Basketball Emmanuel College
…
See more

As a member of the media, Phil possesses a tireless work ethic and an un-bias delivery when reporting. He is a basketball enthusiast with a selfless devotion to the game. All college coaches should follow his twitter handle (@PhilKasiecki) and website (www.hoopville.com) for informative and timely material. Phil’s positive reputation is well deserved, and I am fortunate enough to call him a friend.
…
See more

received.text: I was very fortunate to have Gary as a colleague at EST, later Wind River, in my first post-college job. Gary was always someone I could talk shop with, and I did so often. I also specifically remember when shared a series of e-mails to a number of us about using VxWorks more than just in passing as most of us did at that time - in our department, we often used VxWorks BSPs to help us more fully test debugger components, but little more than that - so he is not only highly technically competent, but always happy to engage and share what he knows. He was great as a developer before finding a home in tech support, and there he managed a group that was easy to deal with and always came to me with as much information on a problem as they could gather, making my job a little easier.

Shanikwa is a great combination of being professional and personable. She is not only very good at what she does, but she is also very pleasant to deal with, and that can't be underestimated given the nature of this business. I was fortunate to have her as my tax preparer one year at a firm I regularly went to, and not only was my return - which was not trivial given my situation - well-done and completed well within the allotted time, but I enjoyed being in her company all the while and hoped I could have her again in future years there. She is someone I would not hesitate to call upon again.
